JOSÉ VICTOR

FRONTEND DEVELOPER

DISCOVER

ABOUT

NICE TO MEET YOU!

I started programming in 2017 and graduated as a Computer Technician at the IFRN. I liked to program, it was an interesting challenge, but I took a real rush when I got to the web development part.

When I got to know the frontend and saw the infinite sea of possibilities, I fell in love, I always liked the visual and creative side of things, so I started to interact with the community, working as a team, meeting and exchanging knowledge with new people. essential.

Today, I'm studying Information Systems at UFRN. I want to be a great developer and I am every day studying and striving more and more to become one.

WORKS

NETFLIX TUDUM

Tudum is an international event that announces several news about Netflix projects. In 2021, the 3rd edition took place to celebrate 10 years of Netflix in Brazil. Almanac Tudum was launched together with the event, it is a book with exclusive material about the company's productions.

Hox.rs was responsible for implementing a shorter “virtual version” of Almanac Tudum. Through Figma we had access to the project screens and started development. I worked as a frontend developer creating the code for most of the site's pages.

As it was my first time working in a company, I couldn't believe the moment I saw who the project was for. When I entered Figma and saw that someone from Netflix was working there “on my side”, the feeling was of euphoria.

Working together with a team of developers, learning from them and creating something for such a big name was wonderful.

Of all the projects I've participated so far, this is without a doubt the one I love the most, because it was where it all started and where I was sure it was in this world that I wanted to work.

VISIT Hox.rs - 2021

PERSONAL

TO-DO NOW

This project brought me big changes. The goal was to experiment with new technologies and play with Redux in practice, as the need to manage the state of my applications in a more organized and scalable way was already knocking the door.

When it came time to list what would be needed to create the application, I thought it would be cool to use some tools different from the ones I usually use to increase the range of possibilities, Vite and Stitches are some examples, it was a very interesting process, it's good to get out of the zone of comfort.
